VisualType.description: Which type of floor to use.

PatrolType.description: How this object behaves after arriving at its destination. Return means the object will return to its starting point. Loop means the object will continue moving back and forth indefinitely. OneWay means the object will simply stop moving.

IsEventDriven.description: Whether this object is active by default or must be triggered by something first.

In3D.description: Whether this object is in a 3D section, or a 2D section.

IsOneway.description: Whether you can jump through this floor from the bottom.

DoesFall.description: Whether this floor will fall after the player stands on it for a while.

DoesBreak.description: Whether this floor will crumble into pieces after the player stands on it for a while.

IsSmoothMove.description: Whether this floor's movement is smoothed.

IsReverse.description: Whether this floor's movement is reversed?

MoveVector.description: The XYZ direction this floor moves in.

PathUID.description: The UID of the path used by this object.

WaitTime.description: How long to wait before changing movement direction?

InitialDelay.description: How long the object waits before starting the normal active/inactive cycle.
